p: Once PEDv enters enterocytes it causes them to undergo acute necrosis (Jung et al. 2014). PEDv also causes a reduction in the number of goblet cells, the cells which secrete mucins to defend against microbial infection (Jung and Saif 2015). Cytolysis additionally leads to shortening and severe atrophy of intestinal villi, and causes the tips of villi to erode or become covered with attenuated epithelial cells (Jung et al. 2014; Stevenson et al. 2013). The atrophy of intestinal villi results in microscopic lesions, which are typical of an enteritic infection, (Sueyoshi et al. 1995). PEDv also results in swollen cells, and the detachment of cells from adjacent cells and from the membranes of the basal surfaces (Stevenson et al. 2013).
